alert.note: Alert for Albany; Carbon (Wyoming) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Cheyenne (Southeastern Wyoming and Western Nebraska)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued June 24 at 2:59PM MDT by NWS Cheyenne
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 4 PM MDT THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues across portions of the Mullen Burn Scar. * WHERE...Portions of south central Wyoming and southeast Wyoming, including the following counties, in south central Wyoming, Carbon. In southeast Wyoming, Albany. * WHEN...Until 400 PM MDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Dangerous flows over low-water crossings. River or stream flows could be elevated. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 259 PM MDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. This will cause small stream flooding. Rapid river rises will cause minor flooding in Mullen Burn Scar. Between 0.25 and 0.75 inches of rain have fallen. - Mullen Burn Scar is the most likely place to experience minor flooding. Additional rainfall amounts up to 0.25 inches or less are expected over the area in the next hour. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. Heaviest rainfall will occur over the Mullen Creek, Cottonwood Creek, Lower Douglas Creek and Middle Douglas Creek Watersheds over the hour with high runoff occurring through the afternoon. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Albany, Bobbie Thompson Campground, Illinois Creek Campground, Miller Lake Campground, Evans Creek Campground, Six Mile Campground, Lake Owen, Lake Owen Campground and Woods Landing-Jelm. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Move away from recently burned areas. Life-threatening flooding of creeks, roads and normally dry arroyos is likely. The heavy rains will likely trigger rockslides, mudslides and debris flows in steep terrain, especially in and around these areas.
